respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castItem.roleDesc: Cupid and Amazons, in the mask
Other Lords, Senators, Officers, Soldiers, Banditti, and Attendants

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Athens. A hall in Timon's house.
Enter Poet, Painter, Jeweller, Merchant, and others, at several doors.

l.stage: Enter certain Senators, and pass over.
Enter LORD TIMON, addressing himself courteously to every suitor; a Messenger from VENTIDIUS talking with him: LUCILIUS and other servants following.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: A banqueting-room in Timon's house.
Hautboys playing loud music. A great banquet served in; FLAVIUS and others attending;
then enter LORD TIMON, ALCIBIADES, Lords, Senators, and VENTIDIUS. Then comes, dropping after all, APEMANTUS, discontentedly, like himself.

l.stage: They all stand ceremoniously looking on Timon.
Re-enter CUPID, with a mask of Ladies as Amazons, with lutes in their hands, dancing and playing.
The Lords rise from table, with much adoring of TIMON; and to show their loves, each singles out an Amazon, and all dance, men with women, a lofty strain or two to the hautboys, and cease.
Exeunt all but Apemantus and Timon.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: A Senator's house.
Enter Senator, with papers in his hand.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 2
div.stage: The same. A hall in Timon's house.
Enter FLAVIUS, with many bills in his hand.

l.stage: Enter CAPHIS, and the Servants of ISIDORE and VARRO.
Enter TIMON, ALCIBIADES, and Lords, c.
Enter FLAMINIUS, SERVILIUS, and other Servants.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: A room in Lucullus' house.
FLAMINIUS waiting.
Enter a Servant to him.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 2
div.stage: A public place.
Enter Lucius, with three Strangers.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: A room in Sempronius' house.
Enter SEMPRONIUS, and a Servant of TIMON'S.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 4
div.stage: The same. A hall in Timon's house.
Enter two Servants of VARRO, and the Servant of LUCIUS, meeting TITUS, HORTENSIUS, and other Servants of TIMON'S creditors, waiting his coming out.

sp.speaker: Flaminius
sp.stage: Enter FLAVIUS in a cloak, muffled.

l.stage: Enter TIMON, in a rage; FLAMINIUS following.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 5
div.stage: The same. The senatehouse The Senate sitting.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 6
div.stage: The same. A banqueting-room in Timon's house. Music. Tables set out: Servants attending.
Enter divers Lords, Senators and others, at several doors.

sp.speaker: Timon
sp.stage: The dishes are uncovered and seem to be full of warm water.

l.stage: Throwing the water in their faces.
Throws the dishes at them, and drives them out.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Without the walls of Athens.
Enter TIMON.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 2
div.stage: Athens. A room in Timon's house.
Enter FLAVIUS, with two or three Servants.

l.stage: Servants embrace, and part several ways.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Woods and cave, near the sea-shore.
Enter TIMON, from the cave.

l.stage: Enter ALCIBIADES, with drum and fife, in warlike manner; PHRYNIA and TIMANDRA.
Exit Flavius. Timon retires to his cave.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: The woods. Before Timon's cave.
Enter Poet and Painter; TIMON watching them from his cave.

sp.speaker: Painter
sp.stage: Timon comes from his cave, behind.

l.stage: Beats them out, and then retires to his cave.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 2
div.stage: Before the walls of Athens.
Enter two Senators and a Messenger.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: The woods. Timon's cave, and a rude tomb seen.
Enter a Soldier, seeking TIMON.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 4
div.stage: Before the walls of Athens.
Trumpets sound.
Enter ALCIBIADES with his powers.

l.stage: The Senators descend, and open the gates.
